docs.text: Resolving a Misunderstanding # Vocabulary # delegate You need to delegate some jobs to your assistant, or you'll be exhausted. delineate Our team leader usually delineates the roles of each group member on the weekly meeting. credit She put in a lot of effort but got no credit for solving the problem in the end. My brother was credited with making the business a success, because he led a competent team. by accident We won't blame the people who make mistakes by accident , but just remind them of better ways to deal with things. reach out Don't hesitate to reach out to me if you have any problems with the hotel. I reached out to the landlord when there were some problems with her house. on purpose He park the car in front of the door on purpose . Expression # steal one's thunder I didn't mean to steal Mike's thunder , but my score was much higher than his. put sb's foot in sb's mouth Lvy really put her foot in her mouth . She asked whether Lily's boyfriend was her yonger brother. If you do your research before the project proposal, you won't put your foot in your mouth . (go) behind one's back I sometimes want to go behind Iris's back to find out details, since she never shares enough information. I don't care what they say about me behind my back . (How/What/Why, etc.) in the world How in the world can we pull off the deal when the client is so picky ?
docs.title: Resolving a Misunderstanding

docs.text: You're Not a Good Fit # Conversation # A: We're more than halfway through the quarter. How is your sales team progressing? B: Actually, that's what I want to bring to your attention . I'm not feeling like our work has been up to par lately A: What made you think that? You've always been quite competent . B: The thing is, we're far from reaching our goal. I feel like the team is not as productive as we used to be. A: Have you thought about why? B: I have, The main reason is that I failed to take a proactive approach to respond to the market changes. A: Well, it's a good thing you've realized the problem. B: The bottom line is we don't have much time left and team morale is quite low. A: Have you thought about how to boost them? B: Well, I don't think there's a quick fix to it as long as the numbers still don't look good. A: My advice is to forget about the numbers for now. Focus all of your attention on your staff and services. Make sure they're all on the right trace. B: I think you're right. I shouldn't rush the process , there's more to this than our end goal. A: I've always believed you're a great fit for sales lead. Just trust yourself. B: Thank you for having faith in me. I'll do my best to live up to our company's mission. Vocabulary # up to par My manager said the report wasn't up to par and told me to rewrite it. competent We need a competent manager to reach the objectives both efficiently and effectively. proactive Proactive employees take the initiative to do their work and find solutions to problems. productive The writer wrote three novels in two years, which was surprisingly productive . bottom line The bottom line is that we simply don't have enough time to finish the job in one day. quick fix I don't think there's a quick fix for your financial problems. You must learn to manage your money. Expression # A good fit My past work experience, creativity and versatile skill set make me a good fit for the job. Don't rush the process here Don't rush the process , but trust the process. Have some faith in something Come on. Have some faith in yourself . You'll ace it! Bring to someone's attention I want to bring to your attention that I've made great progress while learning English with you.
docs.title: You're Not a Good Fit
